Altocumulus clouds are a middle altitude cloud genus, the name meaning "cloud in a cluster" or "tasseled cloud". They are often white or grey and appear as patches or rounded masses, which may be semi-transparent. They are formed at an altitude of 2,000 to 7,000 metres (6,500 to 23,000 ft).
